messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>Also, since I am not launching
>the junit (Eclipse is) I don't have the JVM control you state --
especially
>when it is choosing to run tests from multiple projects.

What?! The JUnit test runner *I* know allows you to configure JVM
properties. Certainly the Ant runner does.
Did I miss a meeting?

I have a project that depends upon other projects, both having junit tests.
When I run the tests they run in the current working directory of the
project, and hence I access files relative to that. I could set something
in the JVM for one project, but that isn't the issue. The trouble comes when
the Eclipse junit test collector runs "down" into sub-projects and find and
start running those tests -- in a separate project. The CWD for those test
is "wrong". I'd like to have the test collector ignore tests from other
projects (have not found a way) or somehow realize that they are in a
separate project, and hence run them in that project's context (i.e. CWD).

regards

Adam
